trustfund: TF023975-FAC CONSULTANT TRUST FUND - NEW,TF020620-FORESTY PROJECT IN BKF

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Petroleum Sector
            Reform Project is unsatisfactory; Bank performance was
            deficient in both appraisal and supervision, while the
            borrower performance was deficient in both implementation
            and covenant compliance. The project did not achieve its
            original aim, but did contribute to lay the foundations for
            reform, mainly a draft new legal framework for a privatized
            sector. The Bank de facto unilaterally changed the
            project's scope in terms of reform and pressed the
            government for more radical transformations. The main lesson
            learned is that the Bank should have either maintained the
            original objectives promoting the project with patience, or
            acted more decisively to restructure the project once it
            changed its position on reform. If the infrastructure
            components had been cancelled the project could have instead
            supported investments for which public financing was
            justified in support of the privatization process. Project
            sustainability in terms of legal reform is uncertain,
            because the process is still ongoing.
